result.execSummary:
The defendant William C. Stanley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. William C. Stanley is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • William C. Stanley was found guilty of Neglecting a Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Refrain from conduct which constitutes a violation of the criminal laws of any state of the United States or ordinances substantially conforming to a criminal statute.
Comply with all recommendations made by social services pursuant to informal CHIPs proceedings and complete a parenting class.
Remain subject to bond.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

03:20 PM Defendant William C. Stanley in court.  Mary M Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15CM303, 17TR71 & 17TR72. Court questions Defendant on employment/residence/Drivers License.  Review hearing scheduled for June 17, 2019 at 03:00 pm.

03:40 PM Defendant William C. Stanley in court.  Calling 15cm303, 17tr71, 17tr72. Defendant lost his employment - Court notes that defendant was making payments. Adj. 3:41 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for April 15, 2019 at 03:00 pm.

3:39 p.m. Defendant William C. Stanley in court.  Defendant was in custody and released on 8/28/18. Calling 15cm303, 17tr72, 17tr71. Defendant is not employed. Is attempting to find employment and obtain driver's license. Adj. 3:41 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for January 28, 2019 at 03:00 pm.

-Dispatch does not have active warrant for him at this time - Warrant was sent back from dispatch as there is no III or JR attached to him. - Spoke with Denise in DA - will remove on her name as well -    To be corrected and warrant to be reissued
No appearance or payment of fine, court orders warrant

Defendant William C. Stanley in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.  Defendant William C. Stanley in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2:45
Schiek statement to status of case - defendant now found guilty - Schiek/Burns statement to sentencing - defendant being revoked- waives any further hearing on this case -  Court statement to sentencing - Court imposes $579 plus $200 DNA surcharge  - payment plan provided - may start plan by 4-24 3pm - if defendant is still incarcerated - may contact court
Submit DNA sample -  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4). Court waives the DNA surcharge -and will grant expungement - 
Appeal rights given  Review hearing scheduled for April 24, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

1:31 p.m. Defendant William C. Stanley in court, in custody, via video.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant states he was working - thought court date was 18th - was here in court on 18th of December - was in "lock up". Court points out that 12/18 was a Sunday - Defendant states maybe it was the 19th. Schiek statement to bond. Court reinstates previous signature bond. Adj. 1:33 p.m.  Status conference scheduled for January 3, 2017 at 01:15 pm.

Court notes only one in court is DA Michael Schiek - court goes over motion filed and notes not sure if Atty M.Hogan still on case or not as she appeared as Public Defender, but notes defendant was aware of this hearing today.  Atty Schiek statement - has had no contact with either defendant or Atty Hogan.  Court questions if State would like warrant authorized.   Atty Schiek statement to that.  Based on nonappearance court will reinstitute proceedings against defendant and authorizes warrant.
to reinstitute proceedings

3:38 p.m. Defendant William C. Stanley in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Schiek statement - review of CCAP shows new case in Langlade County - State intends to file motion to rescind based on non-compliance. Defendant states he did not commit crimes in Langlade County - Schiek - no verification of Social Services compliance and compliance with parenting class - Defendant states it was part of treatment at Koinonia. Notice of Motion hearing date will be sent to defendant. Bail continued. Adj.
DEJ filed

3:40 p.m. Defendant William C. Stanley in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea questionaire filed.  DPA provided. State moves to dismiss Count 1 - Granted. Defendant enters no contest plea to Count 2 -   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and accepts Deferred Entry of Judgment. Adj. 3:45 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for November 7, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

2:40 Defendant William C. Stanley in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea 
Bail continued  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 17, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

4:05 p.m. Defendant William C. Stanley in court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant states he thought court date was next Monday - states he is eligible for PD but has not contacted anyone.  Court orders defendant to PD today.  Bond continued.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Defendant refused to sign Sig Bond

Complaint to be faxed to jail, right to counsel - defendant will obtain counsel,  Schiek statement to bail - Court sets $  sig bond  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
